action.action-desc: Mr. Dent introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To add engaging in or supporting hostilities against the United States to the list of acts for which United States nationals would lose their nationality.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Enemy Expatriation Act.

subsection.text: Section 349 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1481) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in each of paragraphs (1) through (6), by striking or at the end;
in paragraph (7), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: engaging in, or purposefully and materially supporting, hostilities against the United States.
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: For purposes of this section, the term hostilities means any conflict subject to the laws of war.
Section 351(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1483(a)) is amended by striking (6) and (7) and inserting (6), (7), and (8).
